credit_line: Gift of J. A. Lloyd Hyde
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 184.5 x 104.9 cm (6 ft. 5/8 in. x 41 5/16 in.)
title: Textile
description: A panel of glazed cotton, resist-printed, probably by a batik method known as tjap-printing (wax resist applied by means of blocks inlaid with copper strips).  Two-thirds of the piece has diagonal bands filled with tiny zigzag striping alternating with bands of curving vines. This densely patterned area alternates with large stems of flowers and butterflies on a solid dark ground.
name: Textile
